text.p: These are the leading stories in the Beirut press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-Presidents Hrawi and Assad to hold summit meeting today in Damascus.
-Speaker of the outgoing parliament Berri will be re-elected with a high number of votes from the new 128 MPs.
-General Labour Confederation calls for a "salvation programme" to restrain debt, corruption, construction and taxes.
-Berri says President Hrawi's consultations with the MPs to nominate a prime minister will be held on Wednesday and the new cabinet will be formed next week.
-French President Chirac may hold talks with Maronite Patriarch Sfeir during his visit to Lebanon this week.
-Defence Minister Dalloul warns of a social explosion in Lebanon.
-The General Labour Confederation warns of the escalation of the social and economic crisis in the country.
-Weekly treasury bills subscriptions total 702 billion Lebanese pounds.
-German parliamentary delegation visiting Lebanon quotes President Hrawi as saying that it is a nessecity to strengthen the European role in Lebanon.
-Prime Minister Hariri says he supports administrative reform to get rid of corruption in the public administration.
-Four attacks against pro-Israeli militia in south Lebanon, and the guerrillas used SAM-7 anti-aircraft rockets.
